trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your universal Windows 8.1 app | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your universal Windows 8.1 app | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send push notifications to your universal Windows 8.1 app from your JavaScript backend mobile service using Azure Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send push notifications to your universal Windows 8.1 app from your JavaScript backend mobile service using Azure Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services with a JavaScript backend to send push notifications to a universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services with a JavaScript backend to send push notifications to a universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs in a universal Windows app project.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs in a universal Windows app project.

trans-unit.source: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification from the JavaScript backend to all registered Windows Store and Windows Phone Store apps each time a record is inserted in the TodoList table.
trans-unit.target: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification from the JavaScript backend to all registered Windows Store and Windows Phone Store apps each time a record is inserted in the TodoList table.

trans-unit.source: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.
trans-unit.target: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use the tooling in Visual Studio 2013 with Update 3 to add support for push notifications from Mobile Services to a universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use the tooling in Visual Studio 2013 with Update 3 to add support for push notifications from Mobile Services to a universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: The same steps can be used to add push notifications from Mobile Services to a Windows Store or Windows Phone Store 8.1 app.
trans-unit.target: The same steps can be used to add push notifications from Mobile Services to a Windows Store or Windows Phone Store 8.1 app.

trans-unit.source: To add push notifications to a Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone Silverlight 8.1 app, see this version of <linkText>Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To add push notifications to a Windows Phone 8 or Windows Phone Silverlight 8.1 app, see this version of <linkText>Get started with push notifications in Mobile Services</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable push notifications:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable push notifications:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register your app for push notifications</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register your app for push notifications</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Update the service to send push notifications</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Update the service to send push notifications</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Test push notifications in your app</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Test push notifications in your app</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active <linkText>Microsoft Store account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: An active <linkText>Microsoft Store account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows</linkText><title></title> with Update 3, or a later version
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Express for Windows</linkText><title></title> with Update 3, or a later version

trans-unit.source: 6.
trans-unit.target: 6.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the \Services\MobileServices\your_service_name project folder, open the generated push.register.cs code file, and inspect the UploadChannel method that registers the device's channel URL with the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the \Services\MobileServices\your_service_name project folder, open the generated push.register.cs code file, and inspect the UploadChannel method that registers the device's channel URL with the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: 7.
trans-unit.target: 7.

trans-unit.source: Open the shared App.xaml.cs code file and notice that a call to the new UploadChannel method was added in the OnLaunched event handler.
trans-unit.target: Open the shared App.xaml.cs code file and notice that a call to the new UploadChannel method was added in the OnLaunched event handler.

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that registration of the device is attempted whenever the app is launched.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that registration of the device is attempted whenever the app is launched.

trans-unit.source: 8.
trans-unit.target: 8.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous steps to add push notifications to the Windows Phone Store app project, then in the shared App.xaml.cs file, remove the extra call to UploadChannel and the remaining #if...#endif conditional wrapper.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous steps to add push notifications to the Windows Phone Store app project, then in the shared App.xaml.cs file, remove the extra call to UploadChannel and the remaining #if...#endif conditional wrapper.

trans-unit.source: Both projects can now share a single call to UploadChannel.
trans-unit.target: Both projects can now share a single call to UploadChannel.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can also simplify the generated code by unifying the #if...#endif wrapped [MobileServiceClient] definitions into a single unwrapped definition used by both versions of the app.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can also simplify the generated code by unifying the #if...#endif wrapped [MobileServiceClient] definitions into a single unwrapped definition used by both versions of the app.

trans-unit.source: Now that push notifications are enabled in the app, you must update the mobile service to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Now that push notifications are enabled in the app, you must update the mobile service to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: The following steps update the insert script registered to the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: The following steps update the insert script registered to the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: You can implement similar code in any server script or anywhere else in your backend services.
trans-unit.target: You can implement similar code in any server script or anywhere else in your backend services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Windows Store app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Windows Store app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing one of the following tutorials:

trans-unit.source:
Send push notifications to authenticated users
Learn how to use tags to send push notifications from your mobile service to only an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target:
Send push notifications to authenticated users
Learn how to use tags to send push notifications from your mobile service to only an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source:
Send broadcast notifications to subscribers
Learn how users can register and receive push notifications for categories they're interested in.
trans-unit.target:
Send broadcast notifications to subscribers
Learn how users can register and receive push notifications for categories they're interested in.

trans-unit.source:
Send platform-agnostic notifications to subscribers
Learn how to use templates to send push notifications from your mobile service, without having to craft platform-specific payloads in your back-end.
trans-unit.target:
Send platform-agnostic notifications to subscribers
Learn how to use templates to send push notifications from your mobile service, without having to craft platform-specific payloads in your back-end.
